memberdef.argsstring: (Annotation< unsigned int > t_decomposition, Annotation< double > t_penalized_constraints)
memberdef.name: PADM

detaileddescription.para:
Creates and returns a new optimizer to solve the model given as parameter.
t_model
The model which the optimizer will solve
A new optimizer for the model

Creates and return a copy of the optimizer factory. This is used for polymorphism.
A copied object of the current object (i.e., *this)
Sets the log_master level and color for the optimizer

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_logs(true);
t_log_level
the log_master level
t_log_color
the output color
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the time limit for the optimizer

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_time_limit(3600);
t_time_limit
the time limit (in seconds)
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the maximum number of threads which the optimizer can use

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_thread_limit(5);
t_max_n_threads
the number of threads which can be used
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the maximum number of iterations which the optimizer go through

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_iteration_limit(200);
t_iteration_count_limit
the maximum number of iterations
the optimizer factory itself
Sets a threshold on the best bound for stopping the optimizer. When the optimizer have found a best bound which is greater than this threshold, the optimizer stops.
Sets a threshold on the best objective value for stopping the optimizer. When the optimizer have found a best objective value which is less than this threshold, the optimizer stops.
Sets the relative gap tolerance for the optimizer. When the optimizer proves that the relative optimality gap is less than this threshold, the optimizer stops.

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_relative_gap_tolerance(.05);//setsagaptoleranceof5%
t_relative_gap_tolerance
the relative gap tolerance
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the absolute gap tolerance for the optimizer. When the optimizer proves that the absolute optimality gap is less than this threshold, the optimizer stops.

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_absolute_gap_tolerance(1e-4);
t_absolute_gap_tolerance
the absolute gap tolerance
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the get_param_presolve activation for the optimizer.

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_presolve(false);//turnsoffget_param_presolvephase
t_value
the activation level for the optimizer's get_param_presolve (0 for disabling, 1 for enabling)
the optimizer factory itself
Sets the behaviour of the optimizer when a model is shown to be infeasible or unbounded. When set to true, the optimizer is forced to prove feasibility or unboundedness by providing a certificate.

Example: autoalgorithm=GLPK() .with_infeasible_or_unbounded_info(true);
t_value
the activation level
the optimizer factory itself
Executes the lambda function given as second parameter if and only if its first argument is true. This function can be used to build different optimizer factories depending on some external variable.

memberdef.argsstring: (bool t_conditional_value, const std::function< void(PADM &)> &t_if, const std::function< void(PADM &)> &t_else)
memberdef.name: conditional

detaileddescription.para: Executes the lambda function given as second parameter if and only if its first argument is true. This function can be used to build different optimizer factories depending on some external variable.

Example: for(constbooluse_presolve:{true,false}){ autoalgorithm=GLPK() .conditional(use_presolve, [](auto&x){x.with_presolve(true);}, [](auto&x){x.with_presolve(false);}) model.use(algorithm); model.optimize(); }
t_conditional_value
if true, the t_if lambda function is executed, if false, the t_else lambda function is.
t_if
lambda function to execute in case t_conditional_value is true
t_else
lambda function to execute in case t_conditional_value is false
the optimizer factory itself
